title.narrative: Project Her Choice 2016-2020 in Mali

description.narrative: Child marriage is a widespread phenomenon which endangers the healthy develoment and wellbeing of girls and young women all over the world. Each year, 15 million girls get married before the age of 18. Marrying at a young age is detrimental to girls' health and wellbeing, restricts access to education and income-earning opportunities, and often results in social isolation. Child marriage does not only effect the girls involved, but has strong impact on the community and the wider geographic surrounding.

Girls<18; boys<18; family members; teachers and school managers; health workers; traditional and religious leaders; CBOs, including women organisations; female leaders, traditional birth attendants, women who practice FGM; other community members including boys and men; district leaders.

Her Choice works towards a world where girls and women enjoy equal status with boys and men, and are able to achieve their full potential in all aspects of their lives. The program's strategies include empowering girls, creating access to good quality education and SRHR services, creating economic opportunities, changing norms and creating an enabling community and policy environment.

Main Objective: to support the creation of child marriage free communities in which girls are free to decide if, when and whom to marry. Outcomes: a) Girls have increased control in decision-making, especially if, when and whom to marry, and increased access to services. b) Girls have greater decision-making space within communities.
